info.description: An API which allows to retrieve data about the **Roman Calendar** for any given year, between 1970 and 9999. The data strives for historical accuracy (memorials and feast days are only generated from the year in which they were effectively introduced). The data is based on original sources (Roman Missals, Decrees of the Congregation for Divine Worship, Mysterii Paschalis, etc.), not on data copied or retrieved from online sources which may not be accurate. The API offers multiple locales and multiple calendars, from the **General Roman Calendar** to national or diocesan calendars.
info.title: Liturgical Calendar

tags.name: All possible liturgical events endpoint
tags.description: All liturgical events by key without the calendar calculation

tags.name: Calendar Source Data
tags.description: Retrieve / create / update / delete source data for National, Diocesan or Wider Region calendars

tags.name: Missals
tags.description: Retrieve / create / update / delete Roman Missal definitions

tags.name: Easter
tags.description: dates of easter whether gregorian or julian from 1583 to 1999

tags.name: Unit Test Index endpoint
tags.description: Retrieve / create / update / delete unit tests

get.summary: Retrieve liturgical events for the General Roman Calendar for each day of the current year
get.description: By passing in the appropriate options, you can retrieve data for the liturgical calendar for any given year

200.description: OK: liturgical events for a given year according to the requested criteria

X-LitCal-Starttime.description: High resolution timestamp in nanoseconds that indicates the start time of the calculation of the current liturgical calendar response

X-LitCal-Endtime.description: High resolution timestamp in nanoseconds that indicates the end time of the calculation of the current liturgical calendar response

X-LitCal-Executiontime.description: Total time in nanoseconds in which the calculation of the current liturgical calendar response was produced (difference between X-LitCal-Starttime and X-LitCal-Endtime, average is usually about 5ms!)

X-LitCal-Generated.description: Indicates whether the current response was produced from: a fresh calculation since the response to the given request had not yet been calculated, or from client cache since the response has not changed since last request, or from server cache since the client had not yet made this same request but the calculation had already been done formerly on the server

text/calendar.example:
BEGIN:VCALENDAR PRODID:-//John Romano D'Orazio//Liturgical Calendar V1.0//EN VERSION:2.0 CALSCALE:GREGORIAN METHOD:PUBLISH X-MS-OLK-FORCEINSPECTOROPEN:FALSE X-WR-CALNAME:Roman Catholic Universal Liturgical Calendar LA X-WR-TIMEZONE:Europe/Vatican X-PUBLISHED-TTL:PT1D BEGIN:VEVENT CLASS:PUBLIC DTSTART;VALUE=DATE:20291231 DTSTAMP:20240422T062620Z UID:c0e7126a841a70761e4057e58b5e2d52 CREATED: DESCRIPTION:\nSOLLEMNITAS\nalbus LAST-MODIFIED: SUMMARY;LANGUAGE=la:SOLLEMNITAS SANCTÆ DEI GENITRICIS MARIÆ Missa in Vigi lia TRANSP:TRANSPARENT X-MICROSOFT-CDO-ALLDAYEVENT:TRUE X-MICROSOFT-DISALLOW-COUNTER:TRUE X-ALT-DESC;FMTTYPE=text/html:\n\n\n\n


SOLLEMNITAS
< SPAN LANG=la>albus
ANNUM B

\n\n\n END:VEVENT END:VCALENDAR

304.description: Not Modified: client should use cached results seeing that the response has not changed

400.description: Bad Request: invalid parameters or malformed data in request body

406.description: Not Acceptable: Accept header requests a response Content Type which this API cannot produce

415.description: Unsupported Media Type: Content Type of request not valid

418.description: I'm a teapot: request in this case must be an AJAX request, but AJAX request not detected

get.summary: Retrieve liturgical events from the liturgical calendar for a given nation for each day of the current year
get.description: By passing in the appropriate options, you can retrieve data for the liturgical calendar for any given year

schema.summary: uppercase two letter ISO 3166 code of a nation for which the liturgical calendar has been defined

200.description: OK: liturgical events for a given year according to the requested criteria

X-LitCal-Starttime.description: High resolution timestamp in nanoseconds that indicates the start time of the calculation of the current liturgical calendar response

X-LitCal-Endtime.description: High resolution timestamp in nanoseconds that indicates the end time of the calculation of the current liturgical calendar response

200.description: OK: liturgical events for a given year according to the requested criteria

X-LitCal-Starttime.description: High resolution timestamp in nanoseconds that indicates the start time of the calculation of the current liturgical calendar response

X-LitCal-Endtime.description: High resolution timestamp in nanoseconds that indicates the end time of the calculation of the current liturgical calendar response

X-LitCal-Executiontime.description: Total time in nanoseconds in which the calculation of the current liturgical calendar response was produced (difference between X-LitCal-Starttime and X-LitCal-Endtime, average is usually about 5ms!)

X-LitCal-Generated.description: Indicates whether the current response was produced from: a fresh calculation since the response to the given request had not yet been calculated, or from client cache since the response has not changed since last request, or from server cache since the client had not yet made this same request but the calculation had already been done formerly on the server

text/calendar.example:
BEGIN:VCALENDAR PRODID:-//John Romano D'Orazio//Liturgical Calendar V1.0//EN VERSION:2.0 CALSCALE:GREGORIAN METHOD:PUBLISH X-MS-OLK-FORCEINSPECTOROPEN:FALSE X-WR-CALNAME:Roman Catholic Universal Liturgical Calendar LA X-WR-TIMEZONE:Europe/Vatican X-PUBLISHED-TTL:PT1D BEGIN:VEVENT CLASS:PUBLIC DTSTART;VALUE=DATE:20291231 DTSTAMP:20240422T062620Z UID:c0e7126a841a70761e4057e58b5e2d52 CREATED: DESCRIPTION:\nSOLLEMNITAS\nalbus LAST-MODIFIED: SUMMARY;LANGUAGE=la:SOLLEMNITAS SANCTÆ DEI GENITRICIS MARIÆ Missa in Vigi lia TRANSP:TRANSPARENT X-MICROSOFT-CDO-ALLDAYEVENT:TRUE X-MICROSOFT-DISALLOW-COUNTER:TRUE X-ALT-DESC;FMTTYPE=text/html:\n\n\n\n


SOLLEMNITAS
< SPAN LANG=la>albus
ANNUM B

\n\n\n END:VEVENT END:VCALENDAR

304.description: Not Modified: client should use cached results seeing that the response has not changed

400.description: Bad Request: invalid parameters or malformed data in request body

406.description: Not Acceptable: Accept header requests a response Content Type which this API cannot produce

415.description: Unsupported Media Type: Content Type of request not valid

418.description: I'm a teapot: request in this case must be an AJAX request, but AJAX request not detected

get.summary: Retrieve all the unit tests defined in the API `tests` folder as an index useful for frontend processing

200.description: OK: An index of currently defined Unit Tests useful for guaranteeing the health of the API

example.name: MaryMotherChurchTest
example.description: The memorial 'Mary Mother of the Church' was added in 2018 by Decree of the Congregation for Divine Worship on the Monday after Pentecost

assertions.assertion: The memorial 'Mary Mother of the Church' should not exist before the year 2018
The memorial 'Mary Mother of the Church' should be created on the expected date
The memorial 'Mary Mother of the Church' should be created on the expected date

example.name: NativityJohnBaptistTest
example.description: When the Nativity of John the Baptist coincides with the Solemnity of the Sacred Heart, is it correctly moved to June 23?

assertions.assertion: Nativity of John the Baptist should be moved to June 23
Nativity of John the Baptist should be moved to June 23
Nativity of John the Baptist should be moved to June 23

example.name: PrayerUnbornTest
example.description: USA: The National Day of Prayer for the Unborn is set to Jan 22 as per the 2011 Roman Missal issued by the USCCB, however if it coincides with a Sunday or a Solemnity, it should be moved to Jan 23

assertions.assertion: should fall on expected date January 22
should fall on expected date January 23
assertions.comment: this test is significant since January 22nd falls on a Sunday, so the National Day of Prayer for the Unborn should have been moved to January 23rd

assertions.assertion: should fall on expected date January 23
assertions.comment: this test is significant since January 22nd falls on a Sunday, so the National Day of Prayer for the Unborn should have been moved to January 23rd

example.name: StJaneFrancesDeChantalTest
example.description: Saint Jane Frances de Chantal was moved from December 12 to August 12 in the 2002 Latin Edition of the Roman Missal, to allow bishops conferences to insert Our Lady of Guadalupe as an optional memorial on December 12. DOES ST JANE FRANCES DE CHANTAL FALL ON THE RIGHT DAY BOTH BEFORE AND AFTER 2002, OR IT CORRECTLY OVERRIDEN BY GREATER FESTIVITIES?

assertions.assertion: should fall on expected date December 12
should fall on expected date August 12
should fall on expected date August 12
assertions.comment: this test is significant since December 12th falls on a Sunday, so the memorial would have been suppressed if it hadn't been moved

assertions.assertion: should not exist, December 12th is a Sunday

404.description: 404 Not Found: tests folder path could not be opened

The server did not succeed in writing to disk the Unit Test. Please try again later or contact the service administrator for support.

LitCal.description: the liturgical events that make up the requested Liturgical Calendar for the given year

Name.description: the name of the Liturgical Event, localized according to the requested locale or the requested calendar (will be in English for the national USA calendar, Italian for the national Italian calendar, etc.)
examples: Saints Basil the Great and Gregory Nazianzen, bishops and doctors

Color.description: the liturgical color used for the current liturgical event. The color name is CSS ready, therefore it will always be in English. For display in other locales, the ***colorLcl*** element can be used

ColorLcl.description: the liturgical color used for the current liturgical event, localized according to the current requested locale

Type.description: whether the liturgical event is a fixed or a mobile festivity

Grade.description: The logical importance of the celebration, represented as a number from 0 to 7, used to calculate precedence compared to other possible events. The importance or precedence value will determine whether one event may suppress another event or have it moved to the next possible open slot according to certain criteria. A general association with liturgical terminology would be as follows * 0 = WEEKDAY * 1 = COMMEMORATION * 2 = OPTIONAL MEMORIAL * 3 = MEMORIAL * 4 = FEAST * 5 = FEAST OF THE LORD * 6 = SOLEMNITY * 7 = event that has precedence over a solemnity However this association is not suitable for displaying the actual *grade* (or *rank*) of the festivity in liturgical terms, because some events have a logical importance that does not correspond with their portrayed grade, for example "All Souls Day" is called a "Commemoration" and yet it is given the same importance as a solemnity. Thus "All Souls Day" will have a grade of 6, but should be displayed as "Commemoration" rather than as "Solemnity". Therefore the ***displayGrade*** property should be checked first, and if empty then the above indicated association should be valid and can be used

GradeLcl.description: The logical importance of the celebration, represented in human readable form and localized according to the current requested locale

DisplayGrade.description: will often be empty, in which case the ***grade*** or ***gradeLcl*** properties can be used, for the purpose of displaying the rank of the current liturgical event. If non empty, will contain the localized rank of the liturgical event and should be used instead of the ***grade*** or ***gradeLcl*** properties for display purposes

Common.description: if the current liturgical event commemorates a saint, this value if non empty will indicate whether the readings are to be taken from the Proper of Saints (in which case it will have a value of "Proper") or from one of the Commons. In the latter case, if there is more than one possible common, the multiple possible commons will be listed as a comma separated list. Each common can be further specified by a particular category, in which case the specific category within the common will be separated from the common by a colon. Since we are dealing with a logical data structure the values are not localized, localization should be handled by the requesting application

CommonLcl.description: human readable form of the ***common***, localized according to the current requested locale

Date.description: a PHP style unix timestamp (seconds from the Unix Epoch) in UTC time. The time should be a zero value seeing that we deal only with all day events, and time is not of importance. For use in Javascript, multiply this value by 1000, because Javascript uses milliseconds as a base for timestamps, whereas PHP uses seconds. The timestamp value should be dealt with accordingly in each programming language used, as is if the language uses seconds as a base, or multiplying by 1000 if it uses milliseconds as a base.

EventIdx.description: progressive index, one for each liturgical event. Not really very useful. The ***eventKey*** attribute that identifies the liturgical event is more useful.

LiturgicalYear.description: description of the liturgical cycle localized according to the requested locale (or national calendar). This property will only be present for events where it is applicable (Sundays or weekdays of Ordinary Time, Solemnities, Feasts of the Lord, in practice those liturgical events the texts of which are based on the liturgical cycle). When present, it will have a localized value of `YEAR A`, `YEAR B`, or `YEAR C` for festive events or a value of `YEAR I`, `YEAR II` for weekday events (whereas if an application makes a request for the Italian language or the national Italian calendar, the values will contain `ANNO` instead of `YEAR`, and likewise for any localization requested).

LiturgicalSeason.description: Liturgical season that the current liturgical event falls in. Is not present for Vigil Mass events, however in this case it can be retrieved from the 'parent' event using the `isVigilFor` property

DayOfTheWeekIso8601.description: ISO 8601 representation of the day of the week, 1 for Monday, 7 for Sunday

Month.description: Numeric representation of the month of the current liturgical event, 1 for January, 12 for December

Day.description: Numeric representation of the day of the month of the current liturgical event

Year.description: Year of the current liturgical event

HasVigilMass.description: present for applicable events such as Solemnities or Sundays. Will have a boolean value of `true` if the expected Vigil Mass is confirmed, and of `false` if the expected Vigil Mass is superseded by another liturgical event. Sometimes this will be established from year to year for specific coincidences by the Congregation for Divine Worship.

HasVesperI.description: present for applicable events such as Solemnities or Sundays. Will have a boolean value of `true` if the expected First Vespers are confirmed, and of `false` if the expected First Vespers are superseded by another liturgical event. Sometimes this will be established from year to year for specific coincidences by the Congregation for Divine Worship.

HasVesperII.description: present for applicable events such as Solemnities or Sundays. Will have a boolean value of `true` if the expected Second Vespers are confirmed, and of `false` if the expected Second Vespers are superseded by another liturgical event. Sometimes this will be established from year to year for specific coincidences by the Congregation for Divine Worship.

IsVigilMass.description: present for applicable events such as Solemnities or Sundays. Will have a boolean value of 'true' if the event is a Vigil Mass for a Solemnity or Sunday

IsVigilFor.description: present for applicable events such as Solemnities or Sundays. If the event is a Vigil Mass, will indicate the `eventKey` attribute of the `LitCalEvent` for which the current event is a Vigil Mass

Settings.description: echoes back the settings that were requested for the generation of this specific liturgical calendar, as feedback to be sure that the requested settings were correctly applied

Year.description: the year for which the liturgical calendar was requested

Epiphany.description: whether Epiphany was set to be celebrated on January 6th or on the Sunday between January 2nd and January 8th

Ascension.description: whether Ascension was set to be celebrated on Thursday or on Sunday

CorpusChristi.description: whether Corpus Christi was set to be celebrated on Thursday or on Sunday

YearType.description: whether the API calculated a calendar for the solar year (Jan 1 - Dec 31) or the liturgical year (First Sunday of Advent of the preceding year including vigil Mass - Saturday of the 34th week of Ordinary Time)

Locale.description: the locale which has either been specifically requested using the `locale` parameter, or set by the requested national calendar

ReturnType.description: the type of data that was requested

EternalHighPriest.description: whether the celebration of Jesus Christ Eternal High Priest is applicable to the current requested calendar

Metadata.description: contains information about the current endpoint versioning, and keys of liturgical events that can have precedence over others, useful for further calculations of a local calendar

Solemnities.description: the keys of this object identify the liturgical event

LitCalEvent.description: a liturgical event that has a rank of solemnity, and which can therefore supersede a feast or a memorial

Date.description: the date of the liturgical event in the liturgical calendar for the given year (the time will be zeroed out because it is not of importance), in RFC 3339 fomat

TimezoneType.description: describes the timezone type set on the DateTime object in the endpoint's PHP backend (only DateTime objects with type 3 timezones attached will allow for DST correction). The timezone will always be set to "UTC" and therefore the timezone type should always be of type 3, see https://www.php.net/manual/en/timezones.others.php

Timezone.description: the timezone set on the DateTime object in the endpoint's PHP backend (it will always be set to "UTC", in order to ensure the date will remain unchanged anywhere in the world)

Feasts.description: the keys of this object identify the liturgical event

LitCalEvent.description: a liturgical event that has a rank of feast or memorial, and which can therefore supersede a feast (if this event is a higher ranking feast of the Lord, of the BVM, of John the Baptist etc.), a memorial (if this event is a feast) or an optional memorial  (if this event is a memorial)

Date.description: the date of the liturgical event in the liturgical calendar for the given year (the time will be zeroed out because it is not of importance), in RFC 3339 format

TimezoneType.description: describes the timezone type set on the DateTime object in the endpoint's PHP backend (only DateTime objects with type 3 timezones attached will allow for DST correction). The timezone will always be set to "UTC" and therefore the timezone type should always be of type 3, see https://www.php.net/manual/en/timezones.others.php

Timezone.description: the timezone set on the DateTime object in the endpoint's PHP backend (it will always be set to "UTC", in order to ensure the date will remain unchanged anywhere in the world)

Memorials.description: the keys of this object identify the liturgical event

LitCalEvent.description: a liturgical event that has a rank of feast or memorial, and which can therefore supersede a feast (if this event is a higher ranking feast of the Lord, of the BVM, of John the Baptist etc.), a memorial (if this event is a feast) or an optional memorial  (if this event is a memorial)

Date.description: the date of the liturgical event in the liturgical calendar for the given year (the time will be zeroed out because it is not of importance), in RFC 3339 format

TimezoneType.description: describes the timezone type set on the DateTime object in the endpoint's PHP backend (only DateTime objects with type 3 timezones attached will allow for DST correction). The timezone will always be set to "UTC" and therefore the timezone type should always be of type 3, see https://www.php.net/manual/en/timezones.others.php

Timezone.description: the timezone set on the DateTime object in the endpoint's PHP backend (it will always be set to "UTC", in order to ensure the date will remain unchanged anywhere in the world)

Timestamp.description: timestamp at which the current calendar calculation was first requested / produced

DateTime.description: RFC 3339 representation of the date and time at which the current calendar calculation was first requested / produced

RequestHeaders.description: echoes back the request headers that were received by the endpoint, for debugging purposes

Messages.description: an array containing all of the significant operations done in the calculation of the requested Liturgical Calendar, with links to the Decrees of the Congregation for Divine Worship where applicable. Useful for understanding how or why the calculations were done, and what changes have been applied in the generation of the Calendar for the specific year requested.

examples: '4th Sunday of Ordinary Time' is superseded by the FEAST OF THE LORD 'Presentation of the Lord' in the year 2020.
'31st Sunday of Ordinary Time' is superseded by the SOLEMNITY 'All Saints Day' in the year 2020.
The FEAST 'Saints Philip and James, Apostles', usually celebrated on May 3rd, is suppressed by the celebration with precedence over solemnities 'Fourth Sunday of Easter' in the year 2020.

nation.description: Uppercase English name of the nation that corresponds to the current diocesan calendar

diocese.description: Actual name of the diocese, including spaces, hyphens, apostrophes or any other character

group.description: Named group of diocesan calendars which can be pooled together

group_name.description: Named groups of diocesan calendars which can be pooled together

items.description: IETF language codes comprehensive of region and optionally an ISO 15924 script code, following the BCP 47 standard as implemented in PHP intl

data_path.description: Server path to the resource file containing the wider region data

i18n_path.description: Server path to the folder containing the i18n files for the wider region

api_path.description: API URL with which to request the localized wider region data

GeneralRomanCalendarRequestBody.title: General Roman Calendar
GeneralRomanCalendarRequestBody.description: The liturgical calendar in Latin, as used in the Vatican, basis of all other national and diocesan calendars. The only permitted parameters are `year`, `year_type`, and `return_type` (though it's preferable to request the media type using the `Accept` header)

GeneralRomanCalendarTweakedRequestBody.title: General Roman Calendar translated
GeneralRomanCalendarTweakedRequestBody.description: General Roman Calendar in another language or with tweaked parameters, perhaps for testing purposes

CivilOrLiturgicalYear.title: Liturgical or Civil year
CivilOrLiturgicalYear.description: The liturgical year starts from the First Sunday of Advent of the preceding year and ends on the Saturday of the 34th week of Ordinary Time, as opposed to the civil year which starts on Jan 1st and ends on Dec 31st

ExactOrVariableCorrespondenceUnitTest.title: Exact or Variable Existence
ExactOrVariableCorrespondenceUnitTest.description: test that the liturgical event exists on an expected date in a given year or does not exist in a given year

name.description: identifies the Unit Test, and follows the pattern `{event_key}Test`

event_key.description: the liturgical event we are testing, must be the exact key of a corresponding liturgical event in the LitCal API

description.description: describes what the test intends to accomplish

test_type.description:
* `exactCorrespondence`: the liturgical event should exist on an expected date for each of the years defined in the `years` array
* `variableCorrespondence`: the liturgical event should not exist for certain years, and should exist on an expected date for other years

ExactCorrespondenceSinceUnitTest.title: Exact Existence Since Year
ExactCorrespondenceSinceUnitTest.description: test that the liturgical event exists on an expected date starting from a given year

name.description: identifies the Unit Test, and follows the pattern `{event_key}Test`

event_key.description: the liturgical event we are testing, must be the exact key of a corresponding liturgical event in the LitCal API

description.description: describes what the test intends to accomplish

test_type.description: the liturgical event should exist on an expected date starting from the year indicated in the `yearSince` key, before such year the liturgical event should not exist

ExactCorrespondenceUntilUnitTest.title: Exact Existence Until Year
ExactCorrespondenceUntilUnitTest.description: test that the liturgical event exists on an expected date up until a given year

name.description: identifies the Unit Test, and follows the pattern `{event_key}Test`

event_key.description: the liturgical event we are testing, must be the exact key of a corresponding liturgical event in the LitCal API

description.description: describes what the test intends to accomplish

test_type.description: the liturgical event should exist on an expected date until the year indicated in the `yearUntil` key, after such year the liturgical event should not exist

event_key.description: corresponds to the `event_key` property of liturgical events in the output of the LitCal API and similar endpoints

name.description: The actual name of the liturgical event as defined in the latest edition of the source Roman Missal indicated in the key `MISSAL` (i.e. if the Missal is the Latin edition of the Roman Missal, the name should be from the latest edition of the Latin Roman Missal)

missal.description: When a liturgical event is defined in a Roman Missal, this property will be present with an indication of the Roman Missal in question

decree.description: When a liturgical event is defined ex-novo by a decree of the Congregation of Divine Worship rather than by a Roman Missal, this property will be present with a reference to the decree

locale.description: indicates the locale used to produce localized data in litcal_events

national_calendar.description: indicates the National Calendar used to produce the data in litcal_events

diocesan_calendar.description: indicates the Diocesan Calendar used to produce the data in litcal_events

locale.description: indicates the locale used to produce localized data in litcal_events

national_calendar.description: indicates the National Calendar used to produce the data in litcal_events

locale.description: indicates the locale used to produce localized data in litcal_events

EventExistsAndHasExpectedTimestampAssert.title: Event exists and has expected timestamp
EventExistsAndHasExpectedTimestampAssert.description: Expect that a liturgical event be present in the calendar on the expected date in the given year

year.description: the year we are testing against

comment.description: any extra information about the significance of the expected value for this year compared to other years

EventNotExistsAssertion.title: Event not exists
EventNotExistsAssertion.description: Expect that the liturgical event not be present in the calendar in the given year

year.description: the year we are testing against

comment.description: any extra information about the significance of the expected value for this year compared to other years

LiturgicalYearRequestBody.description: The liturgical year starts from the First Sunday of Advent of the preceding year and ends on the Saturday of the 34th week of Ordinary Time

CivilYearRequestBody.description: The civil year starts on Jan 1st and ends on Dec 31st of the requested year

GeneralRomanCalendarTweakedRequestBody.summary: General Roman Calendar with settings tweaked similarly to how a National or Diocesan calendar would set them
GeneralRomanCalendarTweakedRequestBody.description: Request the data of the General Roman calendar with a few underlying parameters tweaked
